org.dellroad.stuff.io

Class CSVOutput

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dellroad.stuff.io.CSVOutput

  • public class CSVOutput
extends java.lang.Object
    CSV file output stream that ensures values are matched to the correct columns. This class requires the OpenCSV library.
    See Also:
    OpenCSV

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSVOutput

        public CSVOutput(java.io.Writer writer,
         java.lang.String... columns)
        Constructor.

        The column headers will be written out automatically.

        Parameters:
        writer - destination for the CSV output
        columns - CSV columns names in their desired order
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if writer is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if columns is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if columns contains a duplicate column name

      • CSVOutput

        public CSVOutput(java.io.Writer writer,
         java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> columns)
        Constructor.

        The column headers will be written out automatically.

        Parameters:
        writer - destination for the CSV output
        columns - CSV columns names, iterated in their desired order
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if writer is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if columns is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if columns contains a duplicate column name

        The column headers will be written out automatically.

        Parameters:

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if columns contains a duplicate column name

      • writeRow

        public void writeRow(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> row)
        Output a CSV row.
        Parameters:
        row - mapping from column name to value; missing or values are treated as null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if row contains an unknown column name

      • formatObject

        protected java.lang.String formatObject(java.lang.String columnName,
                            java.lang.Object value)
        Format a CSV column value.

        The implementation in CSVOutput applies the following logic:

        • null values are output as the empty string
        • Boolean values are output as 1 or 0
        • Date values are output by delegating to formatDate()
        • All other objects are output using String.valueOf(java.lang.Object)

        Subclasses should override as needed.

        Parameters:
        columnName - name of the column
        value - column value; will be null if no value was present in the Map parameter to writeRow(java.util.Map<java.lang.String, ?>)

      • formatDate

        protected java.lang.String formatDate(java.lang.String columnName,
                          java.util.Date date)
        Format a Date value.

        The implementation in CSVOutput delegates to DateEncoder.encode().

        Subclasses should override as needed.

        Parameters:
        columnName - name of the column
        date - column value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if date is null
